     {

       {
         maxHeight = $(this).height()
       }

     $('div.algemenelinksbanner_links').each(function ()
     {
       $(this).height(maxHeight);
     });

     //Deze 20 pixels zijn voor: correctie 5 pixels toppadding, correctie 15 pixels bottompadding.
     $('div.algemenelinks_background').height(maxHeight + 20);
   });

    <!--
     Onderstaande script is een aanpassing van het originele Google script, zodat het werkt met 
     de bovenstaande asp.net controls.
     Originele script: http://www.google.com/coop/cse/brand?form=cse-search-box&amp;lang=nl
     -->
    <script type="text/javascript">
     (function () {
                         var q = document.getElementById('GoogleSearch_q');                        var n = navigator;
                         var l = location;
                         if (n.platform == 'Win32') {
                             q.style.border = "1px solid #CFD2DB";
                             q.style.padding = "2px;"
                         }
                         var b = function () {
                             if (q.value == '') {
                                 //q.style.background = '#FFFFFF url(http:\x2F\x2Fwww.google.com\x2Fcoop\x2Fintl\x2Fen\x2Fimages\x2Fgoogle_custom_search_watermark.gif) left no-repeat'; 
                                 q.style.background = '#FFFFFF url(\x2Fimages\x2Ftop\x2Fgoogle\x2Fgoogle_custom_search_watermark_nl.gif) left no-repeat';                            }
                         };
                         var f = function () {
                             q.style.background = '#ffffff';
                         };
                         q.onfocus = f;
                         q.onblur = b;
                         if (!/[&amp;?]q=[^&amp;]/.test(l.search)) {
                             b();
                         }
                     })();
    </script>
    <!-- 
     In order to make the button's click event fire when the text box is highlighted, we have to
     have a second text box be a part of the form.  Make it invisible so that the user never 
     knows it's there.
 
     From what research I did, this appears to be an IE-specific problem.  Nevertheless, this 
     was the only "solution" I found.
     -->
   </form>
